{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3359957,"name":"James Goebel","username":"RummelRobotics","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/bc8723/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T14:34:13.329Z","cooked":"

I looked through the legal parts list for 2024 and did
not see the part in the legal section. It was shipped in
a kit from First. It seem to work fine and the recommended
distance sensor by rev has been out of stock. I also
purchased the Pololu laser sensor from Andymark.
I also did not see it on the legal parts list. Can we use
these sensor’s legally on the out of season contests or
do the same rules apply for those contests.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T14:34:13.329Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":27,"reads":395,"readers_count":394,"score":219.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":462428,"topic_slug":"is-maxbotic-ultrasonic-illegal-for-2024","display_username":"James Goebel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-maxbotic-ultrasonic-illegal-for-2024/462428/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3359959,"name":"Brad","username":"Bmongar","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bmongar/{size}/228654_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T14:36:13.362Z","cooked":"

I thought the legal parts list was for actuators. I was under the impression that sensors that didn’t otherwise interfere with robot operation were legal as long as they fell under the robot power rules

As far as I know, any sensor is legal as long as it fits within cost restrictions and doesn’t rely on radio frequencies to function.

The word “ultrasonic” does not appear anywhere in the 2024 game manual, and none of the references to "sensor"s includes any restrictions that would prohibit the use of any ultrasonic sensor as far as I can tell.

EDIT: Oh, are we talking about FTC? That might change things a bit.

RummelRobotics:

This is the list we check every year.
https://www.firstinspires.org/sites/default/files/uploads/resource_library/ftc/legal-illegal-parts-list.pdf

Based on that document, I would think any ultrasonic sensors would fall under the “COTS Parts RM01, RM02” category on page 17.

In general, my experience with FTC is that unless it’s specifically prohibited, it’s generally allowed.

EDIT:

See also: “RE11 - Sensors” in Traditional Manual part 1 on page 38

I was referring to FRC. My mistake when I used google
to search and not look at the top of the document.
It was fist on the search list. I know they had a legal motors
to use list somewhere for first and I thought sensors would
be included.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-04-12T15:30:04.775Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":148,"readers_count":147,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":462428,"topic_slug":"is-maxbotic-ultrasonic-illegal-for-2024","display_username":"James Goebel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":6560,"username":"cbale2000","name":"Chris Bale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":61778,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/is-maxbotic-ultrasonic-illegal-for-2024/462428/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"+1","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3360496,"name":"Zach Hoegberg","username":"Zaque","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zaque/{size}/257827_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-12T22:49:34.258Z","cooked":"

Just to make sure this is perfectly clear, the FRC ruleset explicitly defines restrictions related to actuators (motors and pneumatics), power, and control. Outside of those restrictions, the general philosophy is permissive of anything else that meets the cost and safety rules, including sensors. There is no exhaustive list of legal/illegal parts outside of Table 8-1 in R501, and the required control system components in sections 8.6 and 8.7.

I highly recommend reading the entirety of Section 8 of the game manual to make sure you understand what is required, what is allowed, and what is forbidden. (Post back here on Chief or feel free to send me a DM if you have questions while reading.) Luckily, the majority of this section remains the same year-to-year, so once you understand it you only need to keep up with minor updates in future seasons.
